CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ethel Brown, dress shop employe [sic], 3365 Milwaukee Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think parents should permit teen-agers to smoke, particularly those who still are in school?" answer reads: "No, they should not. It isn't nice and they are too young.  Furthermore, it is not good for their health."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ethel Brown wearing eyeglasses and tweed coat, holding two paper bags, standing on sidewalk of street with automobiles and buildings, Downtown
